intro: Ranunculus brevidens, commonly known as the short-stemmed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped yellow flowers with numerous stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves that are deeply lobed. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it prefers well-drained, rocky soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. Ranunculus brevidens is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude climates.
